[Home](./index.md) &gt; [lib-ethers-u](./lib-ethers-u.md) &gt; [EthersLiquityConnectionOptionalParams](./lib-ethers-u.ethersliquityconnectionoptionalparams.md) &gt; [useStore](./lib-ethers-u.ethersliquityconnectionoptionalparams.usestore.md)

## EthersLiquityConnectionOptionalParams.useStore property

Create a [LiquityStore](./lib-base-u.liquitystore.md) and expose it as the `store` property.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
readonly useStore?: EthersLiquityStoreOption;
```

## Remarks

When set to one of the available [options](./lib-ethers-u.ethersliquitystoreoption.md)<!-- -->, [ReadableEthersLiquity.connect()](./lib-ethers-u.readableethersliquity.connect_1.md) will return a [ReadableEthersLiquityWithStore](./lib-ethers-u.readableethersliquitywithstore.md)<!-- -->, while [EthersLiquity.connect()](./lib-ethers-u.ethersliquity.connect_1.md) will return an [EthersLiquityWithStore](./lib-ethers-u.ethersliquitywithstore.md)<!-- -->.

Note that the store won't start monitoring the blockchain until its [start()](./lib-base-u.liquitystore.start.md) function is called.
